H0.text: Filtration and evaporation are the two methods that can be used to separate the sand from the water when a student mixes a spoonful of sand into a beaker of water.

H1.text: Settling and chromatography are the two methods that can be used to separate the sand from the water when a student mixes a spoonful of sand into a beaker of water.

H2.text: Chromatography and filtration are the two methods that can be used to separate the sand from the water when a student mixes a spoonful of sand into a beaker of water.

H3.text: Settling and magnetic attraction are methods that can be used to separate the sand from the water when a student mixes a spoonful of sand into a beaker of water.

A4.text: Filtration is used to remove large particulates suspended in fluids, such as sand in water.

A5.text: Evaporation removes liquid from a solid by vaporization or evaporation, which could separate water from sand.
